business.headline: Sensex, Nifty end higher on global recovery and RBI rate cut expectationsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 1,089.18 points to close at 74,227.08, while the NSE Nifty5o gained 374.25 points to end at 22,535.85.

RBI MPC to announce decision on April 9: Will there be a rate cut?Since the last MPC meeting, held in February 2025, a lot of things have changed, both positive and negative. While inflation has come down, and growth has started to pick up, there are fresh worries about the global economy.

'Economic nuclear war': Billionaire business titans slam Trump's tariff gambitDonald Trump's tariff agenda is fracturing elite support, with top businessmen — from Bill Ackman to Jamie Dimon — warning it risks recession, inflation, and global instability.

Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia on Indian engineers: '99% start giving gyaan'Sabeer Bhatia pointed out that in India, people respect those who talk business, not those who write code or build software. This mindset, he says, is stopping India from becoming a hub of innovation.

Sensex up 1,600 points: Which stocks are driving the rally on Dalal Street?Markets saw a huge rebound from yesterday's crash as they staged a robust recovery as no stocks on the Sensex of Nifty50 traded in red in the afternoon session.

Trump's tariff war may backfire, says JPMorgan CEO, urges stronger India tiesJPMorgan CEO, Jamie Dimon, explained that higher costs of imported goods would affect consumers, while increased demand for local products could also drive prices up.

Unified Pension Scheme: Centre studying global models to manage UPS pool corpusThe government aims to create proper rules for investing the extra contribution made by it in a separate pension fund called the pool corpus under the newly launched Unified Pension Scheme (UPS).

Japan's Nikkei leads Asia's recovery as hopes rise for softer tariff approachA 5.6% rebound in Japan's Nikkei far outpaced other regional markets, with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Trade Representative Jamieson Greer tasked with leading trade negotiations with Tokyo.

Explained: Why Titan share price jumped 7% after hitting 52-week lowThe recovery in Titan share price came just a day after the stock touched its 52-week low of Rs 2,947.55. In the morning session, Titan shares climbed to a high of Rs 3,222, providing some relief to investors after a tough few months.

Sensex, Nifty in green: Why is stock market rising today? 3 things to knowSensex, Nifty today: Tracking global markets that showed signs of recovery, Sensex and Nifty surged more than 1.5% in early trade, shaking off fears that had weighed heavily just a day earlier, with early buying seen across most sectors.
Sensex, Nifty gain as global markets recover from Trump's tariff shockThe S&P BSE Sensex surged 1,217.78 points to 74,355.68, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 380.50 points to 22,542.10 as of 9:35 am.
Global markets show signs of recovery. Will Sensex and Nifty gain today?A slight improvement in global markets, especially in the US and Asia, has brought some hope after the recent sell-off.

entertainment.headline: Krrish 4: Hrithik Roshan in triple role, reuniting with Preity Zinta | ExclusiveActor Hrithik Roshan will most likely be seen in a triple role in the next Krrish film. The movie will also see him sharing screen space with close friend Preity Zinta once again.

Chef Vikas Khanna backs actor Gaurav Khanna as he gets trolled for copying a dishActor Gaurav Khanna faced criticism over the originality of his dessert on Celebrity MasterChef. However, chef Vikas Khanna has now come out in support of the actor and extended his best wishes to all the contestants of the season.
Govinda's wife Sunita Ahuja gets angry over divorce rumours: Dogs will barkGovinda's wife Sunita Ahuja reacted to divorce rumours. Angry with the rumours, Ahuja said, 'dogs will bark.'

Now You See Me: How the magical heist franchise was ahead of its timeThe Now You See Me franchise introduced audiences to a world where magic and heists collided, offering a fresh twist on the crime genre. Before the third film hits the theatres, let us delve into why and what made this franchise stand out.

Allu Arjun turns 43: Icon star greets fans outside his homeTelugu superstar Allu Arjun's birthday turned into a grand fan celebration on Tuesday. A sea of fans gathered outside his residence in Hyderabad, and the actor was seen greeting the crowd and waving to them warmly.

TAPS: How a YouTube film is broadening the understanding of queer lives A short film on YouTube, titled 'TAPS', has travelled across the world through various film festivals. Backed by Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal, it became one of the most seamlessly designed films on gay relationships in India.

Filmmaker Alfonso Cuaron in talks to direct new James Bond movieAcclaimed director Alfonso Cuaron is reportedly in talks to direct the next James Bond movie. While an official announcement is yet to be made, the filmmaker hinted about the project during a recent event.

5 reasons why Allu Arjun and Atlee's big-budget actioner could be a game-changerThe announcement video of Allu Arjun's next with Atlee was more than a birthday special teaser - it offered a glimpse into one of Indian cinema's most ambitious projects. Built with global technicians and futuristic storytelling tools, the mega-budget actioner aims to set a new benchmark for mainstream Indian entertainment.

Influencer Apoorva Mukhija's powerful post, her first after Latent row, police casesYouTuber Apoorva Mukhija broke silence and spoke about receiving death and rape threats after India's Got Latent controversy. The actor shared her first post after wiping her social media clean following the backlash.
John Lithgow wins best actor at Olivier Awards for role in GiantJohn Lithgow won Best Actor at the Olivier Awards 2025 for his role in Giant, exploring Roald Dahl's dark legacy.

Pulse review: Charming, and strictly for fans of Grey's AnatomyReleased-Fri Apr 04, 2025The new Netflix medical drama, 'Pulse', has got nothing new to offer, but it's an easy watch - like background noise you can follow while doing chores. With Willa Fitzgerald and Colin Woodell leading the series, it certainly is a good-looking show.

Saif Ali Khan teams up with Hansal Mehta for Black River adaptation, confirms authorAfter Jewel Thief, actor Saif Ali Khan collaborated with Hansal Mehta for the adaptation of the book Black River. Its author, Nilanjana Roy, confirmed the news.

Prabhas's The Raja Saab to release in November? Director Maruthi shares updateDirector Maruthi recently shared photos of himself visiting temples in Tirupati and Srikalahasti in Andhra Pradesh. A curious fan asked for an update about the film's release.

The Phoenician Scheme trailer: Wes Anderson promises absurd drama with A-list castHollywood's acclaimed director Wes Anderson is back with another quirky movie, this time, featuring a star-studded cast. The Phoenician Scheme releases this summer.

Robert De Niro to receive Lifetime Achievement Award at 78th Cannes festivalCelebrated actor Robert De Niro will receive an honorary Palme d'Or for his lifetime achievements at the 78th Cannes Film Festival. This marks a significant return for De Niro, who has a rich history with the festival.

Raid 2 trailer: Ajay Devgn wants to take down Riteish Deshmukh in political dramaAjay Devgn and Riteish Deshmukh feature in the latest trailer of the gripping drama, Raid 2. This time, Devgn's character Amay will be seen waging a war against Deshmukh's character.

Twinkle Khanna's niece Naomika steals hearts, internet thinks she's very prettyNaomika Saran, who's the granddaughter of Dimple Kapadia, joined her during the Maddock Films event on Monday in Mumbai. Her photos have taken over social media and people can't get enough of her beauty.

Is Sunny Deol ready to work with Shah Rukh Khan again after Darr? Actor respondsActor Sunny Deol recently opened up about the possibility of working with superstar Shah Rukh Khan once again. The pair had collaborated on the 1993 release, Darr.

Sunny Deol doesn't want Jaat to be called a religious film. Here's whyActor Sunny Deol recently attended a press event in the capital where he opened up about his upcoming release, Jaat, and said that he doesn't want it to be labelled as some kind of 'religious film.'

general news.headline: Kalyan Banerjee's tirade against 'rude female MP' as Trinamool feud goes publicA bitter feud between Trinamool lawmakers came into public after the BJP's IT Cell in charge Amit Malviya shared a video and screenshots of a heated exchange between them.

Cannot sit on bills: Top court raps Tamil Nadu Governor, clears 10 pending billsIn a landmark ruling, the Supreme Court declared that Governors cannot indefinitely delay action on bills, calling such inaction unconstitutional and illegal.

Canada raises minimum wages, Indians, in particular, will benefitAmid the high cost of living in Canada, the increase in the minimum wage in the private sector might bring some relief to those in temporary jobs, especially Indian students. Since April 1, the minimum wage has been raised from 17.30 Canadian dollars to 17.75 per hour.

Axe is out for parody, Justin Trudeau's Ego to be hurtX, formerly Twitter, is full of parody accounts of Donald Trump, Justin Trudeau, Narendra Modi and even its owner, Elon Musk. From April 10, such accounts must use different profile pictures and add words like 'parody' or 'fake' to their handle names. Though some are slamming this kill-joy move, others are saying this was much-needed.

No, Mamata doesn't need to go to jail for Bengal teachers. Here's a way outOver 25,000 teachers lost their jobs in West Bengal after a Supreme Court ruling on a tainted recruitment process. The list includes scores of candidates who made it on merit and their lives have been upended. CM Mamata Banerjee said she was ready to go to jail for them. Mamata doesn't need to go to jail, but do something simple to save thousands of families from financial ruin.

KKR vs LSG Live: Narine, Rahane aggressive after De Kock departsKolkata Knight Riders (KKR) vs Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) Live Score IPL 2025: Digvesh Rathi has got the crucial wicket of Sunil Narine. Venkatesh Iyer has joined his skipper Ajinkya Rahane in the middle.

Cops suspect Pak spy agency behind grenade attack outside BJP leader's Punjab homeA Punjab top cop said that a Pakistan-based man is among the key conspirators of the attack at BJP leader Manoranjan Kalia's house in Jalandhar.

JEE candidates say they missed exam as Pawan Kalyan's convoy blocked wayOver 20 JEE aspirants in Visakhapatnam allegedly missed their exam due to traffic delays reportedly caused by Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan's convoy. However, the police denied the allegation, but Kalyan's office ordered an inquiry into the incident.

Stand down: Mamata Banerjee's 'no interviews diktat' as Trinamool MPs squabbleTrinamool Congress was left red-faced after BJP shared a leaked video and screenshots of a fiery exchange among prominent lawmakers of the party.
Delhi EV Policy 2.0: What the future holds for the people of DelhiWe tell you what the EV Policy 2.0 holds for the people of Delhi. Will you be able to continue your vehicle and how?
Dead for 10,000 years: The science behind resurrecting dire wolvesThe project marks the first successful de-extinction of a species and redefines possibilities for conservation.

Three of world's top 5 slowest cities are in India, reveals study. Check rankingThree Indian cities are among the world's 5 slowest cities for traffic, according to TomTom's 2024 Index, with commute times exceeding 34 minutes per 10 km. The study also revealed that people in these cities lost 111.67 hours (on an average) annually due to rush-hour gridlock.

Is your vitamin D low? Your gut might be paying the priceThat post-lunch bloat, those unpredictable bathroom visits, and even chronic conditions like IBS or IBD could be tied to that sunshine vitamin you've been neglecting.

Supreme Court cancels CBI probe into additional teacher posts in BengalThe bench, led by CJI Sanjiv Khanna, observed that there was no need for judicial intervention as the additional posts were created by the Bengal education department only after necessary consultations and also with the approval of the Governor.

Minor traffic offences can now get your student visa revoked in USAccording to an Associated Press report, some international students have had their visas cancelled for minor infractions, such as traffic violations. Others have faced revocations for social media activity.

Two suns are on their way to collide. Explosion will be visible on EarthWith the gap between them very gradually narrowing as the binary system loses energy, the fact that they are so massive and so close ensures their demise over a large timescale.
Time magazine puts Remus on cover: The dire wolf resurrected from extinctionTime magazine featured Remus, the world's first dire wolf to exist in over 10,000 years, on its cover.

Karnataka 2nd PUC Results 2025 Declared Live: Scorecard download link now activeKSEAB Class 12th Results Live Updates: The Karnataka School Examination and Assessment Board (KSEAB has declared the 2nd PUC (Class 12) Exam 1 results today, April 8, 2025. The results have been announced at a press conference by the board authorities, and the scorecard download link has been activated at 1:30 pm. Students can check their provisional mark sheets on karresults.nic.in and kseab.karnataka.gov.in.

Detained, checked by male officer, no restroom: Indian woman's US airport ordealAn Indian woman claimed she was detained at a US airport, stripped of her warm clothes, and a male officer physically checked her.

sports.headline: Travis Head denies fan's selfie request while shopping: 'Showing too much attitude'Australia and Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) batter Travis Head denied a fan's selfie request while shopping. He was pestered by a fan continuously for a photograph.

Rishabh Pant, don't act like MS Dhoni: Fans mock LSG captain for 'hiding' vs KKRRishabh Pant's decision to demote himself during the KKR vs LSG clash saw him get trolled by fans on social media on Tuesday, April 8. Pant didn't come out to bat as LSG scored 238 runs at the Eden Gardens.

Mitchell Marsh turns out biggest value pick for LSG, smashes 48-ball 81 vs KKRMitchell Marsh continued his golden run in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) as he played a breathtaking 81 against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) in Match 21 of the tournament at Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

Iyer went to finish the tournament as India's leading run-getter.

Will struggling CSK step up today? Big test awaits them in battle of KingsIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Struggling Chennai Super Kings are in desperate need of reviving their campaign. They take on Punjab Kings, who have been finding it difficult to win at home, in Mullanpur on Tuesday, April 08.

New Zealand head coach Gary Stead to step down from white-ball formatsNew Zealand head coach Gary Stead has announced that he will step down from the role of white-ball coach. Stead has said that he will rethink his position as the Test coach as well.

Powerplay with both bat and ball a big concern for MI: Coach JayawardeneMumbai Indians head coca Mahela Jayawardene has said that his team is lacking in the powerplay with both bat and ball. After their loss against RCB, MI are at the 8th position in the IPL points table.

Bhuvneshwar Kumar goes past Bravo, becomes most successful pacer in IPL historyRCB fast bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar scripted history with the wicket of Tilak Varma on Monday. With the wicket, Bhuvneshwar overtook Dwayne Bravo as the fast bowler with most wickets in the history of the IPL.

Devdutt Padikkal credits captain Rajat Patidar for RCB's brilliant startRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) batter Devdutt Padikkal has credited captain Rajat Patidar for his side's impressive start in the ongoing IPL 2025 after the 12-run win over MI.

On Monday, RCB stormed to their third win out of four matches in the ongoing tournament after beating Mumbai Indians by 12 runs.

Will Pucovski retires at 27 after multiple concussions: Star's tragic storyOnce touted as the Australian batting prodigy, Will Pucovski has retired from all forms of cricket after a prolonged battle with concussion injuries. In an emotional interview, the 27-year-old has explained the daily struggles he faces due to concussion injuries.

KKR vs LSG: Smart Kolkata face confident Lucknow in City of JoyIPL 2025, KKR vs LSG Match Preview: Kolkata Knight Riders and Lucknow Super Giants will be looking to continue their winning momentum when they face each other in Kolkata on Tuesday, April 8.

Saliva usage helps to shut out death overs with reverse swing: Lockie FergusonPunjab Kings fast bowler Lockie Ferguson shared his thoughts about the lifting of the saliva ban in the ongoing Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) and said that it has massively helped bowlers to find some reverse swing in the death overs.

MI head coach not worried about Rohit Sharma's weakness against left-arm seamersMumbai Indians head coach Mahela Jayawardene said that he isn't too concerned about Rohit Sharma's weakness against left-arm seamers and said that he will find a way to counter it.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
